title: Replace homepage video background with animated forest scene

requirements.summary: Replace the full-screen ocean waves video hero background on the Home page with an immersive Three.js/React Three Fiber animated forest scene featuring layered particle systems, animated foliage geometry, and soft dappled lighting effects in a forest green and earthy brown palette, while preserving all existing hero overlay content.
acceptanceCriteria: The ocean waves video element is fully removed from the Home page hero section
A Three.js/React Three Fiber canvas fills the full-screen hero area as the background
The scene renders visible animated particles (dust motes or light rays) with soft golden/amber coloring
Foliage or tree silhouette elements in deep greens and earthy browns are visible in the scene
Gentle ambient animation loops continuously without hard resets or stutters
The color palette uses forest greens, warm browns, and soft golden light accents
All hero overlay text (headline, subheadline, CTA buttons) remains fully readable on top of the 3D background
The canvas is responsive and fills the viewport on mobile, tablet, and desktop
Performance is acceptable â€” animation runs at a smooth frame rate on modern devices
No external video files or network requests are required for the background

file_operations.description: Add @react-three/fiber, @react-three/drei, and three dependencies to support the Three.js animated forest scene canvas.

Create a Three.js/React Three Fiber component that renders an immersive animated forest scene. The scene includes: a Canvas filling its container; layered particle systems using Points geometry to simulate floating dust motes and light rays with soft golden/amber colors (#d4a843, #f0e68c at low opacity); animated instanced meshes or geometry representing tree silhouettes and foliage in deep greens (#2d5a27, #4a7c59, #1a3a1a) and warm earthy browns (#6b4423, #8b6914); directional and point lights with gentle position/intensity animation to create dappled light effects; a continuous animation loop using useFrame to update particle positions, foliage sway, and light movement; and responsive camera settings that adapt to viewport dimensions. The component should export a single ForestScene component wrapping the Canvas.

Remove the existing full-screen video element and background video source from the hero section. Replace it with the ForestScene component as the hero background. Ensure the ForestScene canvas is positioned absolutely behind the hero overlay content (headline, tagline, CTA buttons, scroll indicator) with proper z-index layering so all text remains fully readable. Preserve all existing hero section content and structure. The ForestScene should fill the full hero container and be responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports.
